title: High School - English II for Speakers of Other Languages
subject: Spanish Language Arts and Reading (2017-)

document.title: TEXAS ESSENTIAL KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS FOR SPANISH LANGUAGE ARTS AND READING AND ENGLISH AS A SECOND LANGUAGE

85BC5C7041D743F9A3C6B14D5D6C9F4E.description: use an appropriate mode of delivery, whether written, oral, or multimodal, to present results.

96497495B3C246EDBFC9950258054A3A.description: incorporate digital technology when appropriate; and

478ED28B5AAA41FDB43FCA92725A3E56.description: display academic citations, including for paraphrased and quoted text, and use source materials ethically to avoid plagiarism;

9974FD27ADAF4968AA8781A005E19309.description: faulty reasoning such as incorrect premise, hasty generalizations, and either-or;

5D88E6A8B9354FC2B0F0FFCDF0D7C62A.description: credibility and bias, including omission; and

EB10A52CCE7B430D9A4B0D6F1A19B923.description: synthesize information from a variety of sources;

2B43095BAA1B44E6A40893B77217D04D.description: modify the major research question as necessary to refocus the research plan;

35D36EC734FB431B923B3DCEAD588EB2.description: critique the research process at each step to implement changes as needs occur and are identified;

B4BEBF6398B74B5D86B00CE1D368BCCA.description: develop questions for formal and informal inquiry;

2C28636CC0AD4288A00AEF1DD37D485E.description: Inquiry and research: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking using multiple texts. The student engages in both short-term and sustained recursive inquiry processes for a variety of purposes. Based on the student's language proficiency level, and with appropriately provided English language development scaffolding, the student is expected to:

8D16BEE788314FB8817CFB7A1E746D9E.description: compose correspondence in a professional or friendly structure.

D5C1912440524E1CB2B8095EE3D2DBEB.description: compose argumentative texts using genre characteristics and craft; and

91972107519347C38C6D238B8E33A839.description: compose informational texts such as explanatory essays, reports, and personal essays using genre characteristics and craft;

E7D195711BF74DC892EC5199ED829A94.description: compose literary texts such as fiction and poetry using genre characteristics and craft;

7A3A7D990E724D2F895FE42F19C784D7.description: Composition: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking using multiple texts--genres. The student uses genre characteristics and craft to compose multiple texts that are meaningful. Based on the student's language proficiency level, and with appropriately provided English language development scaffolding, the student is expected to:

0B076F2C820D4C02AF8BA9ABB7CAEAED.description: publish written work for appropriate audiences.

BCD689F93A3749B398674E41D837C978.description: use sentence-combining techniques to create an increasingly complex variety of sentence structures and lengths;

6C1FE4C023554A5DAF23A4A5D710EDB5.description: punctuation, including commas, semicolons, colons, dashes, and parentheses, to set off phrases and clauses as appropriate; and

8FE52B1705004A0DA337EB669464F980.description: consistent, appropriate use of verb tense and active and passive voice;

17DA4E18C11C4F749E061192E2BDB616.description: a variety of complete, controlled sentences and avoidance of unintentional splices, run-ons, and fragments;

6301091B8435495A9ED90AE8940104DD.description: edit drafts using standard English conventions, including:

65C22A741ABC485BB3DD718FACFFA53E.description: revise drafts to improve clarity, development, organization, style, diction, and sentence effectiveness, including use of parallel constructions and placement of phrases and dependent clauses;

1A82B35504F64D34A3E4C84FA9CAA34B.description: developing an engaging idea reflecting depth of thought with specific details, examples, and commentary;

EB15B546A2ED42C89C012F9335E06824.description: using an organizing structure appropriate to purpose, audience, topic, and context; and

5C258278CDE246B8A4216AC677912226.description: develop drafts into a focused, structured, and coherent piece of writing in timed and open-ended situations by:

CDD4AF5E930C44B689EE66CF9F8A327F.description: plan a piece of writing appropriate for various purposes and audiences by generating ideas through a range of strategies such as brainstorming, journaling, reading, or discussing;

E9E4B7937356483C8DBC9A05D6813E98.description: Composition: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking using multiple texts--writing process. The student uses the writing process recursively to compose multiple texts that are legible and use appropriate conventions. Based on the student's language proficiency level, and with appropriately provided English language development scaffolding, the student is expected to:

4EAE8EE9548042BD981679D0D18271D6.description: analyze the purpose of rhetorical devices such as appeals, antithesis, parallelism, and shifts and the effects of logical fallacies.

974AE417351A4297B18E88677798AF76.description: analyze how the author's diction and syntax contribute to the mood, voice, and tone of a text; and

5BD91E2FB0C24D29AC98662ABAE220DA.description: analyze the use of literary devices such as irony, sarcasm, and motif to achieve specific purposes;

E5289436673347DABD1A0A44EFE7BDE6.description: analyze how the author's use of language informs and shapes the perception of readers;

D6EAF17CEC8048BCAFDF86403EAA395F.description: evaluate the author's use of print and graphic features to achieve specific purposes;

89443AFB0A194A0790388B5BE5A2F99C.description: analyze use of text structure to achieve the author's purpose;

B04B94094A084DDAA1E13330AE27D871.description: analyze the author's purpose, audience, and message within a text;

FAC2553FFE8A4715B5869A016D7D0271.description: Author's purpose and craft: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking using multiple texts. The student uses critical inquiry to analyze the authors' choices and how they influence and communicate meaning within a variety of texts. The student analyzes and applies author's craft purposefully in order to develop his or her own products and performances. Based on the student's language proficiency level, and with appropriately provided English language development scaffolding, the student is expected to:

58006D8C652141ACAE8B743085F58357.description: analyze characteristics of multimodal and digital texts.

DB0CA8B77D324E628FCAAA177228600F.description: various types of evidence and treatment of counterarguments, including concessions and rebuttals; and

D642F6B6B0574AEA94554A7992F8C00E.description: controlling idea and clear arguable claim, appeals, and convincing conclusion;

5625CA154A374F67BEC18AAF08416EC0.description: analyze characteristics and structural elements of argumentative texts such as:

7DFF679DD7B347E39E44F28ACBF60AC7.description: the relationship between organizational design and thesis;

3EB72301708443BA8CA98D96E0CB4755.description: organizational patterns such as description, temporal sequence, cause and effect, compare and contrast, and problem and solution; and

289413E56C374465B6861F0EB81316A1.description: chapters, sections, subsections, bibliography, tables, graphs, captions, bullets, and numbers to locate, explain, or use information and gain understanding of text;

53B06CBB9F1F47FEB626CBDA09E83655.description: clear thesis, relevant supporting evidence, pertinent examples, and conclusion;

D1B6D3AA3ED546EBAAA09F0958FF4A98.description: analyze characteristics and structural elements of informational texts such as:

52EAC1D28E2C47D8A806ED428D43D8B9.description: analyze the function of dramatic conventions such as asides, soliloquies, dramatic irony, and satire;

BD4FB717237E4078B74D808E5E9146E6.description: analyze the effects of metrics; rhyme schemes; types of rhymes such as end, internal, slant, and eye; and other conventions in poems across a variety of poetic forms;

DD0834AF54414F92BAF2FB180C6A3AA8.description: read and analyze world literature across literary periods;

A541A2833F4944DE95AE40E2267A878A.description: Multiple genres: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking using multiple texts--genres. The student recognizes and analyzes genre-specific characteristics, structures, and purposes within and across increasingly complex traditional, contemporary, classical, and diverse texts. Based on the student's language proficiency level, and with appropriately provided English language development scaffolding, the student is expected to:

8E6504BA28F049DDA7234A185EAD5F7D.description: analyze how historical and cultural settings influence characterization, plot, and theme across texts.

84E2E30AFD5F4557848673E8FDD244D3.description: analyze isolated scenes and their contribution to the success of the plot as a whole; and

1FBEC236EB784E42BE0E309826FFFB27.description: analyze how authors develop complex yet believable characters, including archetypes, through historical and cultural settings and events;

A677AC2A00744FE69557BA7B752260DF.description: analyze how themes are developed through characterization and plot, including comparing similar themes in a variety of literary texts representing different cultures;

F3A8E7F5BAF544F7B14D1256D16110B4.description: Multiple genres: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking using multiple texts--literary elements. The student recognizes and analyzes literary elements within and across increasingly complex traditional, contemporary, classical, and diverse literary texts. Based on the student's language proficiency level, and with appropriately provided English language development scaffolding, the student is expected to:

14D61E351E6446FC8B861C83E0965B3F.description: express opinions, ideas, and feelings ranging from communicating in single words and short phrases to participating in extended discussions.

6B1B0BC149714102932D15BE5618CD7E.description: defend or challenge the authors' claims using relevant text evidence; and

7C7A9B83290242C4AF80FC4895786E11.description: reflect on and adjust responses when valid evidence warrants;

EC47C6C6E5E2490492BCB1715F4D53CA.description: respond orally or in writing with appropriate register, vocabulary, tone, and voice;

3D55B569F2BD46FD8F00DDC753D03CCC.description: discuss and write about the explicit or implicit meanings of text;

06A66022F0D641828F5749996FCD357B.description: respond using acquired content and academic vocabulary as appropriate;

F935A2E688DC4F39AD2ECD8942F7207C.description: interact with sources in meaningful ways such as notetaking, annotating, freewriting, or illustrating;

13A1A0062AC64EC6A9D55E80DA38483D.description: paraphrase and summarize texts in ways that maintain meaning and logical order;

042DFA5B76A6454BBFB371AA9AEA3E0A.description: use text evidence and original commentary to support an interpretive response;

7EF91E2F0E35417D90962A605CD893B1.description: write responses that demonstrate understanding of texts, including comparing texts within and across genres;

97FFB3EBC684401D850E32FA665648F3.description: describe personal connections to a variety of sources, including self-selected texts;

5B364DBD11E34DD397143C1F1D82E0ED.description: Response skills: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking using multiple texts. The student responds to an increasingly challenging variety of sources that are read, heard, or viewed. Based on the student's language proficiency level, and with appropriately provided English language development scaffolding, the student is expected to:

D6C9CD0741BA4BA79A462CE94229B4AC.description: monitor comprehension and make adjustments such as re-reading, using background knowledge, asking questions, and annotating when understanding breaks down.

571CF10141474AA7842CB5DFF87F7C88.description: synthesize information from multiple texts to create new understanding; and

EF93F7090059404FA7296A6B85246C4C.description: evaluate details read to determine key ideas;

0BF6D867968141A69F48C32AF12559C4.description: make inferences and use evidence to support understanding;

5991B054E17541FB8EBF8D999CB96847.description: make connections to personal experiences, ideas in other texts, and society;

EA2ED9A0012940B6931E548EDE86359C.description: create mental images to deepen understanding;

7C94AED778764FB38698CBD12013523D.description: make and correct or confirm predictions using text features, characteristics of genre, and structures;

76C4429B997E40B8994CC53F3F9D267B.description: generate questions about text before, during, and after reading to acquire and deepen understanding and gain information;

5C12C1F3B577427C96EB44CCFC778CDD.description: establish purpose for reading assigned and self-selected texts;

2D1124E946B64160859FB6C5B1E09037.description: Comprehension skills: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking using multiple texts. The student uses metacognitive skills to both develop and deepen comprehension of increasingly complex texts. Based on the student's language proficiency level, and with appropriately provided English language development scaffolding, the student is expected to:

1AB091EE4E3B46E8A2DACFE5B78D2224.description: Developing and sustaining foundational language skills: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking--self-sustained reading. The student reads grade-appropriate texts independently. The student is expected to self-select text and read independently for a sustained period of time.

41BCE99A4B564713A91A726F948CBD79.description: Developing and sustaining foundational language skills: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking--fluency. The student reads grade-level text with fluency and comprehension. Based on the student's language proficiency level, and with appropriately provided English language development scaffolding, the student is expected to adjust fluency when reading grade-level and language proficiency-level text based on the reading purpose.

438B7A82697349E8A52B2682BC8976B4.description: investigate expressions such as idioms and word relationships such as antonyms, synonyms, and analogies.

5055FA5BC9884BD9BDB60311725DF4F7.description: use multiple-meaning words, homographs, homophones, and commonly confused terms correctly; and

50F5CC24002B4C108BF100B12470F48D.description: identify and use words that name actions, directions, positions, sequences, and locations;

AC546ED953A744D9A233B954326CE27C.description: determine the meaning of foreign words or phrases used frequently in English such as pas de deux, status quo, déjà vu, avant-garde, and coup d'état;

00CDF97094D34A52B5BB0281A4B78E26.description: analyze context to distinguish among denotative, connotative, and figurative meanings of words;

A2738675659C4580BE8886C75B89786D.description: use print or digital resources such as glossaries or technical dictionaries to clarify and validate understanding of the precise and appropriate meaning of technical or discipline-based vocabulary;

E4FA24509D73445D969CB873569F0503.description: Developing and sustaining foundational language skills: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking--vocabulary. The student uses newly acquired vocabulary expressively. Based on the student's language proficiency level, and with appropriately provided English language development scaffolding, the student is expected to:

EDB5431F25D3405F8CD2655890D904AE.description: write complete words, thoughts, and answers legibly.

A77EE080B09044FF9988023A8043E727.description: demonstrate and apply phonetic knowledge; and

F6E2A006C8954D7D8D4E899EDCD65161.description: Developing and sustaining foundational language skills: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking--beginning reading and writing. The student develops word structure knowledge through phonological awareness, print concepts, phonics, and morphology to communicate, decode, and spell. Based on the student's language proficiency level, and with appropriately provided English language development scaffolding, the student is expected to:

18FFE423B0F245248B2E28116501329E.description: listen and respond to critique from peers after an oral presentation.

DFE43935E3B5455289132190EDDDAF71.description: develop social communication and produce oral language in contextualized and purposeful ways; and

A9E9DBDFB197417EA7371C50975F3ABB.description: participate collaboratively, building on the ideas of others, contributing relevant information, developing a plan for consensus building, and setting ground rules for decision making;

AA60B0AC39E044AE9B0DDC358F311CBB.description: give a formal presentation that incorporates a clear thesis and a logical progression of valid evidence from reliable sources and that employs eye contact, speaking rate such as pauses for effect, volume, enunciation, purposeful gestures, and increasing mastery of conventions of language to communicate ideas effectively;

50A84B0B57FC4E0781C54EE9F7B2E0A2.description: follow, restate, and give complex oral instructions to perform specific tasks, answer questions, or solve problems and complex processes;

DBC9183CD6B6481BBAFCF156D1E488CD.description: share prior knowledge with peers and others to facilitate communication;

0A627E0A7C7240448420803BDE176260.description: engage in meaningful and respectful discourse by listening actively, responding appropriately, and adjusting communication to audiences and purposes;

1EE8D795DA7340EABBB7F0B1EF86EAB8.description: Developing and sustaining foundational language skills: listening, speaking, discussion, and thinking--oral language. The student develops oral language through listening, speaking, and discussion. Based on the student's language proficiency level, and with appropriately provided English language development scaffolding, the student is expected to:
